Description: Body sherd (mended from two fragments) of Chian pottery open vase, possibly a Type B1 or B2 kantharos; white slip; interior glazed (fired red) with trace of single band in added white; exterior reserved with trace of brown band at bottom of sherd; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: According to Williams (1983 169), Type B2 kantharoi have a painted line on the exterior surface of the sherd at the level of the handle root. Given the size of the sherd and the location of the band, the sherd might also come from a Type B1 kantharos which, according to Williams, have two narrow brown lines. Williams, D. ‘Aigina, Aphaia-Tempel 5. The pottery from Chios’, Archäologischer Anzeiger 1983.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1699) (phase 2)
